intro: Leucospermum praemorsum, commonly known as the red torch flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces cylindrical seed pods that split open when mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and sandy soils. Leucospermum praemorsum is also valued for its resilience to drought and coastal conditions.
